chunks.chunk_text: Hello 同情家族歡迎收聽 Look Back Sunday在這個節目John老師會彙整過去不同國家與主題的熱門跟讀文章讓你可以在15分鐘內吸收最精華的世界史詩曲文Let's get right to it!
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: The sudden burst of doomsaying in Britain is rooted at least as much in psychology as economics
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: It's a combination of things that could, in principle, lead to that, but are quite survivable on their own, said Jonathan Ports, a professor of economics at King's College London.We always talk about the 1970s, but it's half a century later, and all sorts of things are different.Britain's economy, he noted,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: has bounced back faster from the pandemic than many experts predictedThe shortages in labour and some goods are likely a transitory effect of reopening much of the economy after prolonged lockdownsRising wages and supply bottlenecks are driving up the inflation rate, while the fuel shortages that have closed dozens of gas stations reflect a shortage of truck drivers, not of energy supplies
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: Nor does Britain have the aging industrial base and powerful unions it had in the 1970sLabor unrest led to crippling strikes that brought down a conservative prime minister, Edward Heath, and one of his Labour Party successors, James Kelligan, after what the tabloids called the winter of discontent in 1979And yet the parallels are suggestive enough that the right-leaning
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: Daily Mail warned that Britain faces winter of woe, a chilly welcome for Prime Minister Boris Johnson as he returned from the United States, having celebrated a new submarine alliance and rallied countries in advance of a UN climate change conference in Scotland in NovemberThat is a very easy ghost to resurrect, said Kim Darroch, a former British ambassador to Washington who now sits in the House of Lords
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: But these are real problemsYou can just see this perfect storm coming

chunks.chunk_text: to the speedy distribution of COVID-19 vaccines

chunks.chunk_text: Bitcoin is a growing list of records called blockchain
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: that are linked using cryptographyEach block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp and transaction dataBy design, a blockchain is resistant to modification of its data
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: While this week's introduction of a five-pence charge for plastic shopping bags in England did not lead to a nationwide mutiny, as some had warned, it did prove polarizingEnvironmentalists, for the most part, praised the government initiative introduced on Monday, October 5, saying it would reduce pollution and wasteAfter all, it can take a thousand years for a plastic bag to decompose, according to an estimate by Nick Clegg
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: who was Deputy Prime Minister at the time the step was announcedLast year, major supermarkets in England handed out roughly 7.6 billion single-use plastic bags, about 140 per person, the government has estimatedThe government hopes the fee, equivalent to about 8 cents, will help reduce the cost of cleaning up garbage by 60 million pounds or about 80 million US dollars over the next
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 英國趣聞 All about Britain.json

chunks.chunk_text: decadeStores and supermarkets are being encouraged to donate the proceeds from the bag charge to charitable causes and are expected to raise730 million pounds for such endeavorsBut critics of the new fee say it will stoke mayhem, given the long list of exemptions
